snippet: President Obama said that most American military personnel working to fight Ebola in West Africa would soon come home, but that the disease had the potential to flare again.
abstract: Pres Obama says he is withdrawing most American troops from areas of Africa where they had been sent to help control Ebola, as disease has come under control; announcement serves as vindication of Obama's Ebola policy, but has also raised concerns that he may be declaring premature victory.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama said that most American military personnel working to fight Ebola in West Africa would soon come home, but that the disease had the potential to flare again.

headline.main: Withdrawing Troops, Obama Calls for Vigilance on Ebola
headline.print_headline: Withdrawing Troops, Obama Calls for Vigilance on Ebola

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
